text: The women's 100 metres sprint competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 7 and 8 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Pamela Jiles of the United States. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |10.88 |Dresden, East Germany |July 1, 1977 |- |Pan American Games record | |11.20 |Cali, Colombia |1971 |} ==Results== All times shown are in seconds. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font-size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Heats=== Held on 7 July Wind: Heat 1: +1.4 m/s, Heat 2: +1.6 m/s, Heat 3: +1.4 m/s {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !! Heat !! Name !! Nationality !! Time !!
